caption: A man chases a swarm of desert locusts in Samburu County, Kenya, on 21 May 2020

result.explanation: The image clearly shows a man running through a swarm of locusts.  The caption mentions Samburu County, Kenya, and the date. While the image doesn't explicitly confirm the exact location and date, the visual content strongly supports the caption's description of a man interacting with a desert locust swarm in a location consistent with East Africa.

candidates.title: The Non-Pandemic World Events That Helped Shape 2020 : NPR
candidates.content:
In a year dominated by the global COVID-19 pandemic, the virus' massive disruptions did not signal an end to other major events. Conflicts continued, resumed and broke out. Natural disasters upended lives. Attempts at peace bore some fruit. The Brexit transition continued. And around the world, protesters came into the streets to demand greater freedoms and an end to racial injustice.
Here is a look back at some of the key events that took place outside the United States and helped define this tumultuous year.
Iraq
Ebrahim Noroozi/AP
Australia
Saeed Khan/AFP via Getty Images
Venezuela
Carolina Cabral/Getty Images
Rafael Briceno Sierralta/NurPhoto via Getty Images
Black Lives Matter
Buda Mendes/Getty Images; Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images; Donwilson Odhiambo/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images
Afghanistan
Karim Jaafar/AFP via Getty Images
Rahmat Gul/AP
Kenya
Fredrik Lerneryd/Getty Images
Hong Kong
Kin Cheung/AP
Dale De La Rey/AFP via Getty Images
India
Mukhtar Khan/AP
Lebanon
Houssam Shbaro/Andalou Agency via Getty Images
Belarus
AFP via Getty Images
Israel
Menahem Kahana/AFP via Getty Images
Nagorno-Karabakh conflict
Karen Minasyan/AFP via Getty Images
Ethiopia's conflict
Eduardo Soteras/AFP via Getty Images
Yasuyoshi Chiba/AFP via Getty Images
Saudi Arabia
Marieke Wijntjes/Reuters
Brexit
candidates.description: In a year overshadowed by COVID-19, the world saw plenty of other significant developments. Here are some glimpses of the protests, conflicts  and efforts at peace  that helped define 2020.

final_result.explanation: The internal validation check strongly supports the caption's accuracy. The image clearly depicts a man running amidst a large swarm of locusts, consistent with the description of a man chasing locusts. The mention of Samburu County, Kenya, and the date adds specificity, although the image alone cannot independently verify this information. The external validation check provides supporting evidence by mentioning Kenya in the context of significant events in 2020, including locust swarms. Although it doesn't explicitly corroborate the exact details of the caption (the specific location, date, and the man's action), it aligns with the general context of locust plagues in Kenya during that period.  The lower confidence score from the external check is due to the lack of precise details. Discrepancies: The external check doesn't directly confirm the specific event described in the caption; it only supports the plausibility of locust swarms in Kenya in 2020.  This is not a contradiction, but a limitation of the external evidence. Visual details: The image is consistent with a locust swarm, the man's actions suggest he is attempting to evade or disperse the swarm.  There's no visual evidence to suggest tampering or miscontextualization. The quality of the image helps build confidence in the visual evidence. Conclusion: While the external check provides less specific validation than the internal check, both support the core assertion of the caption. The internal consistency and visual details strongly suggest that the caption is likely accurate.  However, the absence of complete external verification for the location, date, and precise event warrants a moderate confidence score.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal validation strongly supports the caption's accuracy, showing a man interacting with a locust swarm. External validation offers contextual support but lacks specific details about the reported event. Visual evidence is consistent with the caption. A moderate confidence is assigned due to incomplete external verification.
